titleStmt.title: Anno regni Caroli Regis Angliæ, Scotiæ, Franciæ, & Hiberniæ, decimo septimo. At the Parliament begun at Westminster the third day of November, Anno Dom. 1640. In the 16. yeer of the reign of our most gracious soveraign Lord, Charles, by the grace of God, of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland King, Defender of the Faith, &c. A subsidie granted to the King of tonnage, poundage, and other sums of money, payable upon merchandize, exported and imported.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most excellent Majestie: and by the assignes of John Bill,

notesStmt.note: Royal arms on frontispiece; headpiece, tailpiece, initial letter.
Imprint also appears on final leaf, with headpiece and tailpiece.
Text of act in black letter.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

person.persName: the Kings most excellent Majestie: and
